hackathon-description-text: We are passionate about offering attendees a safe, welcoming, and supportive environment to experiment with technology at any experience level. Additionally, we want to generate a larger interest and help more girls learn and thrive in the technology-related fields.
hackathon-eligibility: Anyone who identifies as a female in middle school, high school, and college is welcome. We are inclusive of all non-binary and trans students! Although we do not accept males as attendees, we wholeheartedly welcome all genders to sign up as a mentor, workshop leader, judge, or volunteer!
hackathon-requirements: Your project must be completely built at this hackathon!
hackathon-rules:
We encourage people to work in teams of up to four. Additionally, there will be time in the beginning dedicated for you to find a team! You are not required to submit a hack, but there will be workshops and mentors on-hand to help you. However, if you receive travel reimbursement, you must submit one (specified in our contract)!
To ensure that Superposition II is welcoming, all attendees, mentors, and volunteers are required to abide by our 
. 
All projects must be created during Superposition II. Ideas may be made beforehand, but coding must be during the hackathon. Additionally, teams may not use website, app, or any type of "builder" to assist with their projects (ex. Squarespace, Wix, etc.).
Anyone who violates this Code of Conduct will be immediately removed from the event and will forfeit her swag and prizes, even if she wins.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: - Fire TV Stick with Alexa Voice Remote (for each member)
- Drone with HD Camera (for each member)

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=450 9th St, San Francisco, CA 94103, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: Based on design, UX and UI

hackathon-description-header: Superposition II is a 200-person hackathon aimed at middle school, high school, and college females (trans and non-binary inclusive) in the Bay Area of all experience levels and backgrounds.
